sentence.Network_en: The Kremlin is still insisting on a diplomatic solution to the crisis.
sentence.Network_cn: 俄罗斯中央政府依然坚持通过外交方式解决危机。

sentence.Network_en: He proposed a new diplomatic initiative to try to stop the war.
sentence.Network_cn: 他提出了一项新的外交计划以尽力阻止这场战争。

sentence.Network_en: My limited diplomatic skills were tested to the utmost.
sentence.Network_cn: 我有限的外交手腕儿受到了极其严峻的考验。

list.abs: 外交庇护-外交庇护(diplomatic asylum)是指一国使馆或领馆利用其馆舍,对因违反驻在国法律并将受到驻在国拘捕而申请避难的人(主要是政治犯)给予庇护。-waijiaobihu
How to... ... Insofar as … is concerned 变主动 diplomatic etiquette 外交礼节 professional etiquette 同行间的礼仪, 行规.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (in the sense 'relating to official documents'): from modern Latin diplomaticus and French diplomatique, from Latin diploma (see diploma). Sense 1 (late 18th cent.) is probably due to the publication of the Codex Juris Gentium Diplomaticus (1695), a collection of public documents, many of which dealt with international affairs

entry.def: Diplomatic means relating to diplomacy and diplomats.

example.ex: ...before the two countries resume full diplomatic relations...
example.tran: 在两国恢复全面的外交关系之前

example.ex: Efforts are being made to avert war and find a diplomatic solution...
example.tran: 各方正在为避免战争、寻求外交解决途径而作出积极的努力。

entry.tran: 有手腕的;讲究策略的;圆滑的;婉转的
entry.def: Someone who is diplomatic is able to be careful to say or do things without offending people.

example.ex: She is very direct. I tend to be more diplomatic, I suppose.
example.tran: 她人很直，我觉得我更婉转一些。

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or characteristic of diplomacy;
2. skilled in dealing with sensitive matters or people
3. able to take a broad view of negotiations between states

auth_sentence.content: The two sides do not have formal diplomatic relations.
auth_sentence.res_content: The two sides do not have formal diplomatic relations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The two sides do not have formal diplomatic relations.

auth_sentence.content: There are no diplomatic relations between the two Koreas.
auth_sentence.res_content: There are no diplomatic relations between the two Koreas.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There are no diplomatic relations between the two Koreas.

auth_sentence.content: On Tuesday, he praised Holbrooke's diplomatic skill.
auth_sentence.res_content: On Tuesday, he praised Holbrooke's diplomatic skill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On Tuesday, he praised Holbrooke's diplomatic skill.

means.word_mean: 外交上的, 外交人员的;外交的；从事外交的

sentences.en: There were some mediate contacts between the two countries before their diplomatic relation was established.
sentences.cn: 在两国外交关系建立之前, 已经有些间接的接触。

means.word_mean: 有手腕的, 策略的, 善于交涉的, 圆滑的

sentences.en: You must be more diplomatic in handling the situation.
sentences.cn: 你在处理这一情况时, 必须圆滑。

jushi.english: Jane is the most diplomatic person among them.
jushi.chinese: 简是他们中间最圆滑的人。

jushi.english: There were some mediate contacts between the two countries before their diplomatic relation was established.
jushi.chinese: 在两国外交关系建立之前,已经有些间接的接触。

jushi.english: You have to be very diplomatic if you want him to approve of the plan.
jushi.chinese: 你如果想要他赞成这个计划,就必须善用交际手腕。
